Vesārajja，（‹visārada），【中】自信（perfect selfconfidence （which is of 4 kinds，M．I．71．），self-satisfaction，subject of confidence）。cattāri vesārajjāni（梵 catvāri vaiwāradyāni）﹐四自信、四無所畏。

vesārajja：'self-confidence' of a Buddha is fourfold．He is confident：1．to have attained to a perfect Enlightenment of which it cannot be said that it omits anything essential to it； 2．to have destroyed all cankers （āsava），leaving none that can be said to be undestroyed by him； 3．that what were declared by him as obstacles to liberation are undeniably such； 4．that his teaching fulfils its purpose of actually leading to final liberation from suffering．See A．IV，8； VII，58； M．12．

Vesārajja，（nt．） [abstr．formation fr．visārada，i．e．*vaiśāradya] （the Buddha’s or an Arahant’s） perfect selfconfidence （which is of 4 kinds），self-satisfaction，subject of confidence．The four are given in full at M．I，71 sq．viz．highest knowledge，khīṇāsava state，recognition of the obstacles，recognition & preaching of the way to salvation．See also D．I，110； J．II，27； A．II，13； III，297 sq．； IV，83，210，213； M．I，380； Ps．II，194； Nd<sup>2</sup> 466<SUP>B</SUP>； DhA I 86； DA．I，278； KhA 104； VvA．213； Sdhp．593．（Page 650）
